intro: Antennaria triplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined willow herb, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Antennaria triplinervis is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-altitude and tundra ecosystems.
